intro: Cacalia calva, commonly known as the slender cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Cacalia calva is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
